title: Ticket #1157: condor_rm man page example wrong
description:
originated from Greg T:

A user has pointed out to me that the example in the condor_rm man page is just wrong. It says:

Examples

To remove all jobs of a user named Mary that are not currently running: 

  % condor_rm Mary -constraint Activity!=\"Busy\"

Note that quotation marks must be escaped with the backslash characters for most shells.

This just won't work "Activity" is an attribute of machines, not jobs, so the actual command would be something like 

  % condor_rm Mary -constraint 'JobStatus =!= 2'
remarks:
Can't have both a user and a -constraint specified. condor_rm gives an error message to this if it is tried. Example has been corrected. AND, the usage info for condor_rm is also being changed, as it states that one can have "one or more" of the user, cluster, constraint, etc.

2012-Jul-19 21:54:17 by santos-g:
After my implementation for ticket #1156, condor_rm can have both a user and a -constraint specified, for consistency reasons.

condor_rm won't give an error message to this if it is tried anymore, and will actually remove all jobs owned by the user which match the given constraints.
